name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Theodore H. HEILIG, Jr.

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
LARSEN, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ., dissent.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Theodore H. HEILIG, Jr.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ., dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: John E. Feather, Jr., Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellant.
Malcolm L. Lazin, Don P. Foster, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
526 A.2d 358
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Theodore H. HEILIG, Jr.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 13, 1987.
Decided June 1, 1987.
John E. Feather, Jr., Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellant.
Malcolm L. Lazin, Don P. Foster, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
